src:
Venecija prizemljila Partizan
05 Nov 2019, 21:49 by Darko
Partizan – Venecija 69:83(18:21, 21:16, 9:25, 21:21)
Košarkaši Partizana doživeli su prvi poraz u Evrokupu ove sezone i propustili priliku da već posle šestog kola obezbede plasman u Top 16. Serija crno-belih u Evropi počela je pobedom u Veneciji, a italijanski šampion zaslužan je i za prekid Partizanovog niza pobeda.
Venecija je pred oko 8.000 gledalaca u Štark areni nadigrala beogradski tim, a ključna je bila treća četvrtina u kojoj je Partizan primio 25 poena, a nije postigao nijedan koš iz igre (svih 9 sa linije slobodnih bacanja).
Gosti su bolje počeli utakmicu i posle tri minuta igre Partizan je imao zaostatak od devet poena (0:9). Venecija je do finiša prve deonice održavala prednost, ali su uzastopne trojke Zagorca i Pejdža pokrenule crno-bele koji su prvu četvrtinu završili sa samo tri poena minusa (18:21).
U dobrom ritmu Partizan je nastavio u drugoj četvrtini. Visoka petorka koju je Trinkijeri poslao na parket, a u kojoj je Pejners imao ulogu plejmejkera, iznenadila je goste. Posle trojke Rašona Tomasa Partizan je poveo sa 31:25, a da nije bilo pet promašenih slobodnih bacanja u tom periodu, crno-beli bi se odvojili i na dvocifrenu razliku.



Venecija je odgovorila zonskom odbranom, uz dominaciju Mičela Vota pod obručima. Krilni centar Venecije je u prvom poluvremenu postigao 17 poena i bio najzaslužniji što je njegov tim na odmor otišao sa dva poena zaostatka (39:37).
Italijanski tim je već posle minut igre u trećoj četvrtini ispunio bonus, ali to nije bila prednost za Partizan. Mozli je promašio tri od četiri slobodna bacanja, igra je bila dodatno usporena, a u takvim okolnostima bolje su se snašli gosti. Trojkama Stouna i Deja Venecija je povela sa 44:48 i primorala Trinkijerija da zatraži tajm-aut.
Nije minut odmora mnogo pomogao crno-belima, koji su i dalje imali dosta problema na obe strane terena, kao i prilikom izvođenja slobodnih bacanja. Venecija je lagano dizala prednost koja je u 28. minutu postala dvocifrena (45:55).
Tražio je Trinkijeri novi minut odmora, ali preokreta nije bilo. Na drugoj strani su se raspucali Filoj i Dej i Venecija je u poslednjih deset minuta ušla sa plus 14 (48:62).
Nedostajala je Partizanu energija u trećoj deonici, a činilo se da je ima na početku poslednjeg perioda, kada je postigao četiri laka poena. To je ipak bio samo privid, Venecija nije gubila glavu i kažnjavala je svaki loš napad crno-belih, pa je šest minuta pre kraja pobednik već bio izvestan (55:71).
Mičel Vot je sa 27 poena ostao enigma za Partizanovu odbranu do kraja utakmice. Pored njega, Ostin Dej je postigao 13, a Džulijan Stoun bio na domak tripl-dabl učinka sa 10 poena, 11 skokova i sedam asistencija.
U Partizanu, koji je promašio 14 slobodnih bacanja (19/33), dvocifren učinak imao je samo Rašon Tomas sa 18 poena.

POVEZANE OBJAVE
text:
Venice grounded Partizan
05 Nov 2019, 20:49 by Darko
Partizan - Venice 69:83 (18:21, 21:16, 9:25, 21:21)
Partizan Basketball players suffered their first defeat at EuroCup this season and missed the opportunity to secure a place in the Top 16 after the sixth round.
Venice outstripped the Belgrade team in front of some 8,000 spectators at the Stark Arena, and the crucial quarter was the third quarter in which Partizan conceded 25 points and did not score a single basket (all 9 from the free throw line).
The visitors started the game better and after three minutes of play Partizan had a nine point gap (0: 9). Venice maintained the lead until the finish of the first section, but the consecutive triples of Zagorec and Paige started in black and white which finished the first quarter with only three points minus (18:21).
At a good pace Partizan continued in the second quarter. The high five that Trinkiere sent to the floor, and in which Pajner played the role of playmaker, surprised the guests. After Rashon's three Thomas Partizan led with 31:25 without five missed free throws in that period, the black and whites would have separated by a double-digit difference.



Venice responded with a zonal defense, dominated by Mitchell Watts under hoops. The wing of Venice scored 17 points in the first half and was most deserving of having his team leave with two points behind (39:37).
After a minute of play in the third quarter, the Italian team filled in the bonus, but that was no advantage for Partizan. Mozley missed three of his four free throws, the game was slowed down further, and in those circumstances, the visitors did better. She led the Stone and Dey triples with 44:48 and forced Trinkieri to ask for a time out.
Not a minute of rest helped the black and whites a lot, who still had a lot of problems on both sides of the field, as well as making free throws. Venice lifted the lead slightly, becoming a double digit in the 28th minute (45:55).
He asked Trinkieri for another minute of rest, but there was no turning point. On the other side, Philoy and Day burst in and Venice came in with a plus 14 (48:62) in the last ten minutes.
Partizan lacked energy in the third section, and seemed to have it at the beginning of the last period, when it scored four easy points. It was just a semblance, however, Venice was not losing its head and punishing every bad attack of black and whites, so six minutes before the end the winner was already certain (55:71).
Mitchell Watts, with 27 points, remained an enigma for Partizan's defense until the end of the game. Next to him, Austin Day scored 13 and Julian Stone was home to a triple-double performance with 10 points, 11 rebounds and seven assists.
In Partizan, who missed 14 free throws (19/33), only Rashon Thomas had a double-digit impact with 18 points.
